title: On the stability of Killing cylinders in hyperbolic space
abstract:
In this paper we study the stability of a Killing cylinder in hyperbolic
3-space when regarded as a capillary surface for the partitioning problem. In
contrast with the Euclidean case, we consider a variety of totally umbilical
support surfaces, including horospheres, totally geodesic planes, equidistant
surfaces and round spheres. In all of them, we explicitly compute the Morse
index of the corresponding eigenvalue problem for the Jacobi operator. We also
address the stability of compact pieces of Killing cylinders with Dirichlet
boundary conditions when the boundary is formed by two fixed circles,
exhibiting an analogous to the Plateau-Rayleigh instability criterion for
Killing cylinders in the Euclidean space. Finally, we prove that the Delaunay
surfaces can be obtained by bifurcating Killing cylinders supported on geodesic
planes.
